summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell on the S2 Superseding Indictment. It details logistical arrangements for the public and victims to attend or listen to the proceeding on April 23, 2021, including COVID-19 protocols and teleconference access.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, scheduled for arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case, issuing the order regarding the arraignment logistics.

events.title: Arraignment on S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: Scheduled arraignment proceeding for Ghislaine Maxwell at 2:30 p.m. in Courtroom 24B of the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on a superseding indictment (S2) was scheduled for April 23, 2021.
The court made special provisions for public and victim access due to significant public interest and COVID-19 restrictions, including overflow viewing rooms and a public teleconference line.
The government was ordered to inform the court by April 21, 2021, if any alleged victims wished to attend the proceeding.
Defense counsel was ordered to inform the court by the same date if any of Maxwell's family members wished to attend.
